verses.roman:
tasya patnī-sahasrāṇāṁ
daśānāṁ sumahā-yaśāḥ
daśa-lakṣa-sahasrāṇi
putrāṇāṁ tāsv ajījanat

synonyms: tasya—of Śaśabindu; patnī—wives; sahasrāṇām—of thousands; daśānām—ten; su-mahā-yaśāḥ—greatly famous; daśa—ten; lakṣa—lakhs (one lakh equals one hundred thousand); sahasrāṇi—thousands; putrāṇām—of sons; tāsu—in them; ajījanat—he begot.
translation: The famous Śaśabindu had ten thousand wives, and by each he begot a lakh of sons. Therefore the number of his sons was ten thousand lakhs.
